### addRecord() {#acf4c3f66b71dd4779762f774c48d08cc}

<MemberDefinition

Add unspecified record to slice.

Assign specific record type based on properties and symbol name.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Name">The name of symbol.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Flags">The flags that describe attributes of the symbol.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="GV">The kind of global, if this represents a non obj-c global symbol.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Linkage">The linkage of symbol.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
The non-owning pointer to added record in slice.
</SectionUser>

### findContainer() {#a3842ff31470f2555d64c627ae05c7582}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ObjCContainerRecord &#42; RecordsSlice::findContainer (bool IsIVar, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Name) const</>}>
Find ObjC Container.

This is commonly used for assigning for looking up instance variables that are assigned to either a category or class.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="IsIVar">If true, the name is the name of the IVar, otherwise it will be looked up as the name of the container.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Name">Either the name of ivar or name of container.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
The non-owning pointer to record in slice.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/textapi/recordsslice-h/#l00113">113</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/textapi/recordsslice-h">RecordsSlice.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/textapi/recordsslice-cpp/#l00055">55</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/textapi/recordsslice-cpp">RecordsSlice.cpp</a>.
